exampleSentence.translation: I think that Georgian is beautiful.

vocabulary.notes: Used to introduce complement clauses that function as objects or subjects of verbs. Different from relative clause rom.

exampleSentence.georgian: როდესაც ქართულად ვსაუბრობ, მე უსიამოვნობა ვგრძნობ.
exampleSentence.transliteration: rodesac kartulad vsaubrobo, me usiamovnoba vgrtsnob.
exampleSentence.translation: When I speak in Georgian, I feel uncomfortable.

vocabulary.notes: Temporal conjunction introducing adverbial clauses of time.

exampleSentence.georgian: სანამ წიგნს ვკითხულობ, ხმა არ შემომხმარებოდეს.
exampleSentence.transliteration: sanam ts'igns vk'itkhulob, khma ar shemomkhmarebodes.
exampleSentence.translation: While I'm reading the book, don't distract me.

vocabulary.notes: Can mean both 'until' (temporal limit) and 'while' (duration). Context determines meaning.

exampleSentence.georgian: თუ ბევრს ივარჯიშებ, ქართულ ენას დაეუფლები.
exampleSentence.transliteration: tu bevrs ivardzisheb, kartul enas daeuplebi.
exampleSentence.translation: If you practice a lot, you'll master the Georgian language.

exampleSentence.georgian: მე დავეწყე იმიტომ რომ ქართული კულტურა ჩემთვის საინტერესოა.
exampleSentence.transliteration: me davets'q'e imit'om rom kartuli k'ult'ura chemt'vis saint'eresoa.
exampleSentence.translation: I started because Georgian culture is interesting to me.

vocabulary.notes: Causal conjunction explaining reasons. More common in spoken Georgian than რადგან.

exampleSentence.translation: I study Georgian because the culture is fascinating.

vocabulary.notes: More formal than იმიტომ რომ. Used in written and formal speech.

exampleSentence.georgian: ქართულად ვსწავლობ რათა ქართველ მეგობრებთან ვისაუბრო.
exampleSentence.transliteration: kartulad vsts'avlob rata kartvel megobretan visaubro.
exampleSentence.translation: I study Georgian so that I can talk with Georgian friends.

vocabulary.notes: Purpose conjunction introducing goals or intentions.

exampleSentence.georgian: ვფიქრობ ქართული ლექსი და ისიც ასე ფიქრობს.
exampleSentence.transliteration: vp'ik'rob kartuli lek'si da isits ase p'ik'robs.
exampleSentence.translation: I think Georgian is beautiful, and he/she also thinks so.

vocabulary.notes: Primary coordinating conjunction linking equal elements.

exampleSentence.translation: I will start a lecture, or I will choose practice.
Even if it's difficult, I'll still do it.

exampleSentence.georgian: ბევრს ვივარჯიშებ, ასე რომ მალე ჩავაბარებ გამოცდაში.
exampleSentence.transliteration: bevrs vivardzisheb, ase rom male chavabareb gamotsdashi.
exampleSentence.translation: I practice a lot, so I will pass the exam soon.

vocabulary.notes: Technical term for embedded clauses in linguistic discussion.

exampleSentence.georgian: დაჯგუფება და გამოყოფა წინადადებათა ძირითადი ტიპებია.
exampleSentence.transliteration: dadzg'upeba da gamoq'opa ts'inadadat'a dziritadi t'ipebia.
exampleSentence.translation: Coordination and subordination are basic types of sentences.
In subordination, one sentence is subordinate.
